description: This dashboard works with postgres_exporter for prometheus

panels.description: Time from last Postgres process restart.  < 5m Error, < 30m Warn thresholds by default
panels.title: Uptime Postgres

targets.expr: sum(pg_locks_count{datname=~"$datname", datname!="postgres", instance=~"$instance", mode=~"$mode", mode!="accesssharelock", mode!="rowsharelock", mode!="sharelock"} > 1)

sum(pg_locks_count{datname=~"$datname", datname!="postgres", instance=~"$instance", mode=~"$mode", mode!="accessexclusivelock", mode!="exclusivelock", mode!="rowexclusivelock", mode!="sharerowexclusivelock", mode!="shareupdateexclusivelock" })

panels.title: Mean query time avg 1m by instance

panels.description: Connected sessions, including Postgres internal processes like Autovacuum. < 1 Warn / > 300 Error thresholds by default
panels.title: Active sessions
TOP-5 Most long-running queries by mean_time
TOP-5 Most long-running queries by mean_time second
Mean query time avg 1m by instance
Mean query time by entire database
Total queries count (1m rate) by entire instance
Total queries count (1m rate) by database

panels.description:
write_time - Total amount of time that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are written to disk.

sync_time - Total amount of time that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are synchronized to disk.
panels.title: Checkpoint Stats

panels.description: The setting wal_buffers defines how much memory is used for caching the write-ahead log entries. Generally this value is small (3% of shared_buffers value), but it may need to be modified for heavily loaded servers.
panels.title: Disk-Page Buffers

panels.description: Total amount of data written to temporary files by queries in this database. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why the temporary file was created, and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.
panels.title: Temp File

title: PostgreSQL Overview (Postgres_exporter)
